alert.note: Alert for Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: High Surf Warning issued December 27 at 3:04PM PST until December 28 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 20 to 25 ft through this evening. Dangerously large breaking waves of 25 to 35 are expected tonight into Thursday morning. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Coast and Curry County Coast, which includes all beaches of Curry, Coos, and Douglas Counties. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Extremely large breaking waves will create very hazardous conditions along beaches and area shorelines. Waves will inundate beaches and surge into normally dry areas. Infrastructure damage and significant beach erosion can be expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...King-tides are expected during this time and this will increase the inundation of beaches and increase the risk of beach erosion. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Beaches and coastlines will become hazardous due to very large and life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of beaches, rocks, jetties,piers, and other waterside infrastructure.

area.areaDesc: Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast
